1.text: And I lifted up mine eyes, and saw, and behold a man with a measuring line in his hand.

2.text: Then said I: ‘Whither goest thou?’ And he said unto me: ‘To measure Jerusalem, to see what is the breadth thereof, and what is the length thereof.’

3.text: And, behold, the angel that spoke with me went forth, and another angel went out to meet him,

4.text: and said unto him: ‘Run, speak to this young man, saying: ‘Jerusalem shall be inhabited without walls for the multitude of men and cattle therein.

5.text: For I, saith the LORD, will be unto her a wall of fire round about, and I will be the glory in the midst of her.

6.text: Ho, ho, flee then from the land of the north, saith the LORD; for I have spread you abroad as the four winds of the heaven, saith the LORD.

7.text: Ho, Zion, escape, thou that dwellest with the daughter of Babylon.’

8.text: For thus saith the LORD of hosts who sent me after glory unto the nations which spoiled you: ‘Surely, he that toucheth you toucheth the apple of his eye.

9.text: For, behold, I will shake My hand over them, and they shall be a spoil to those that served them’; and ye shall know that the LORD of hosts hath sent me.

10.text: Sing and rejoice, O daughter of Zion; for, lo, I come, and I will dwell in the midst of thee, saith the LORD.

11.text: And many nations shall join themselves to the LORD in that day, and shall be My people, and I will dwell in the midst of thee’; and thou shalt know that the LORD of hosts hath sent me unto thee.

12.text: And the LORD shall inherit Judah as His portion in the holy land, and shall choose Jerusalem again.

13.text: Be silent, all flesh, before the LORD; for He is aroused out of His holy habitation.
